page.title: 20The Legend of Robin Hood.
page.content: Barnsdale Forest once covered the area and folklore suggests that Robin Hood spent much of his time here. {The Bishop's Tree. One day the{Bishop of Hereford}was riding through Barnsdale Forest. Suddenly before him stood Robin Hood and his Merry men.Before he robbed him of Â£300 Robin made the bishop dance and jig around the tree.The site of the tree is in Skelbrooke Park. {Robin Hood's Well. { }One fine day a young man dressed in green clothes stopped at the well between{Barnsdale Bar and Redhouse } {Roundabout,}to drink.The well was very popular and even more so when a{huge {armchair}was carved out of limestone. He said he had travelled far and was on his way to Barnsdale.The young man was none other than{Robin Hood. }
